title: Mihawk is the Physical Manifestation of Yoru
theory: According to this theory, Dracule Mihawk is not actually human but is the physical manifestation of Yoru, one of the 12 supreme-grade swords. The theory suggests that Yoru is seeking the most powerful swordsman so it can finally have a suitable wielder. The battles with Zoro and Shanks were conducted to test out their capabilities as swordsmen and determine if they are worthy.
author: Unknown

title: Mihawk is Zoro's 'One Piece'
theory: A fan theory suggests that Mihawk represents 'Zoro's One Piece' - meaning that Mihawk is Zoro's final destination and ultimate goal, parallel to how Luffy is searching for the One Piece treasure. Just as finding the One Piece is Luffy's dream, defeating Mihawk and becoming the world's greatest swordsman is Zoro's equivalent treasure. This theory was proposed by Reddit user @EffedUpInGrade3.
author: @EffedUpInGrade3

title: Wado Ichimonji Will Become the First White Blade
theory: This theory proposes that when Wado Ichimonji's personality finally awakens to choose Zoro as its worthy wielder, it will become infused with white Haki instead of becoming a black blade like Yoru. This would be beautiful symbolism of Zoro's inner balance and completion as a swordsman, as well as representing the purity of his promise to Kuina. The theory is significant to Episode 24 because Wado Ichimonji was the only sword that survived Mihawk's attack.
author: Unknown

title: Wado Ichimonji Controls Zoro's Sense of Direction
theory: The Wado Ichimonji is a fancy name that simply means 'straight line through the path of harmony.' This theory suggests that this sword guides Zoro on a single path, causing him to ignore other routes and leading to his notorious inability to navigate. The sword's name and its significance in Episode 24 (being the only sword to survive) may hint at this mystical property.
author: Unknown

title: Zoro Must Turn Wado Ichimonji into a Black Blade to Surpass Mihawk
theory: This theory proposes that Zoro won't be ready to claim the title of greatest swordsman in the world until he can turn Wado Ichimonji into a black blade, matching or surpassing Yoru's status. The significance to Episode 24 is that Mihawk's Yoru is a black blade and represents the pinnacle of swordsmanship. Since Wado Ichimonji survived the clash with Yoru, it has the potential to reach the same level.
author: Unknown
